intro: Ruellia kaokoana, commonly known as the Kaoko ruellia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Ruellia kaokoana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
